page.title: 01West Sussex Woods farmland
page.content: The block lies north of the river Ruther and south of Bexley and Blackdown hills, bounded on the east by Petworth Park. Nearly a third of area is woodland, mainly oak, and the rest if farmland devoted to pasture of cattle and sheep but with some wheat and barley. The river Lod flows southward through the block and the land gently undulates betwen 25 and 135 metres in elevation. It contains one village, Lodsworth, midway between Midhurst and Petworth some 4 miles from each, its popultion is about 500, most of those who work are employed outside the block. The village is served by a general store and post office, a repair garage, a public house and village hall. The parish church lies just outside the block. A bus service connects with Midurst, Petworth and Chichester.
